result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Fitzgerald's letter re Ct appearance on Monday January 25

Defendant in court with Attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael K Jackson in court with attorney Lane Fitzgerald. Prosecuting Atty Patrick D. Winter appeared for State of Wisconsin. Will be a plea on Monday at JS.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael K Jackson Jr
Current: 115 W. Doty Street, C/O Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 01-15-2016)
Prior: 14 Kanazawa Cir, Madison, WI 53718
and returned
Defendant's motion to modify bond.  Argument by Atty Fitzgerald/Argument by Atty Moeser

SIGNATURE BOND SET - REFERRAL TO BMP
  - The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $250 per case. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
- Defendant is banned from south of Siggelkow Rd in the Village of McFarland, Dane County, WI.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Adam R. or Jadis F.
Trial judge - Br 5
